title: Eating viruses can power growth, reproduction of microorganism

Researchers have discovered the first known "virovore," an organism that feeds on viruses. Probably there are many others like it -- an entire, previously unknown food chain.
One day into 2023, and already things are going topsy turvy.
https://www.eurekalert.org/news-releases/975344 #ecology #life

title: Amazon Packages Burn in India, Last Stop in Broken Plastic Recycling System

last_post.content:
Recycling is very, very broken, and we are now years out from when China started rejecting our “recycling”. Now we send it to other countries where it destroys their environment instead of ours. We need to seriously rethink consumption at every level, have real conversations about getting rid of growth as our chief and only goal. #recycling #degrowth #sustainability

https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2022-india-plastic-recycling-pollution/

title: Guardian staff shut out of office as newspaper suffers IT glitch

last_post.content:
Update on the Guardian News ransomware attack. Most staff told to not come into office and continue to work remotely. EDIT: Correction - the early CTO quote from a prior incident at News Corp last year. My apologies, the Press Gazette article was a bit poorly worded. I've not yet seen any specifics on the strain of malware, and it's not clear whether Mandiant has been engaged with Guardian. Some additional coverage here: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2022/12/21/guardian-staff-shut-office-newspaper-suffers-glitch/
https://pressgazette.co.uk/publishers/guardian-ransomware-attack/

It's been an off and on project since 2018 (with a lot more "off" than "on"), but it's finally here. You can read the whole thing online at https://third-bit.com/sdxjs/, but if you buy a copy, all the royalties go to the Red Door Family Shelter in Toronto (https://www.reddoorshelter.ca/). Even if you don't want hard copy, please consider a donation - the last couple of years have been very hard on the people they're trying to help.

title: Public Domain Day 2023 is Coming: Here's What to Know

last_post.content:
Too many people are confused about the public domain (PD) and the works that are no longer protected by copyright. I’m seeing lots of toots about how *all* of this or that artist’s works are now free and that is way wrong. It is work- and date-specific. As an example, @copyrightlately points out in his helpful post that Pooh’s red shirt came later and that version of Pooh is NOT in the PD, but the earliest Pooh stories are.

https://copyrightlately.com/public-domain-day-2023/

I just made my semiannual post to the faculty list serve, and I only see one typo post send. :/

When electronics importer Cara Leon goes missing, private investigator Sam Mujrif is hired by her sister to investigate. Cara is 8 times taller than Sam, but evidence soon points to players much smaller than either of them.

As Sam and his cross-scale colleagues pursue the case, it becomes apparent that Cara’s disappearance is linked to technology with the potential to reshape their whole society, and radically alter the balance of power between the scales.

https://www.gregegan.net/SCALE/SCALE.html

I wrote a 3000+ word case study about the making of fonts for Pentiment, the latest game from Obsidian. 🎮🔤

The case study is the story of making an extremely thorough toolkit of digital fonts to let the team at Obsidian accurately, warmly, and legibly recreate the writing of people living 500 years ago. In total we drew over 2,700 glyphs (including inking these by hand with authentic writing tools). ✍️

#typography #design #typefacedesign #pentiment #gamedev #history

https://lettermatic.com/custom/pentiment

title: Creative Works *Ascend* into the Public Domain

last_post.content:
With a copyright expiration day coming soon, it's time for my periodic reminder: creative works don't "fall" into the public domain, they *ascend* into the public domain.

https://go-to-hellman.blogspot.com/2017/07/creative-works-ascend-into-public-domain.html

title: Effective bike advocacy in the face of declining city budgets

last_post.content:
Things I had success doing when my city was spending zero dollars on bike infrastructure:

1. Creating & printing a bike map
2. Removing "No Bikes" signs
3. Installing public bike racks
4. Organizing cyclists
5. Planning bike lanes-- some got included in long-term plans
6. Convincing the city to ask the DOT for a "complete streets" approach on a state road
7. Putting "Complete Streets" in long term plans.

Tips are shared here:
https://mark.stosberg.com/effective-bike-advocacy-in-the-face-of-declining-city-budgets/?mtm_campaign=masto&mtm_kwd=bikes

#BikeAdvocacy

"What should I measure when the CEO asks for engineering metrics?" is probably the most frequently recurring eng leadership question, and connects into a larger, somewhat nebulous topic: how should you measure engineering organizations?

The biggest challenge with answering this question directly imo is that there are a number of different stakeholders who all want very different things. Literal answers anchor on one stakeholders rather than solving for whole set.

https://lethain.com/measuring-engineering-organizations/

title: A Crucial Particle Physics Computer Program Risks Obsolescence

last_post.content:
“I have seen over the years, consistently, that people who spend a lot of time on computers don’t get a tenure job in physics,” said Vermaseren.

“It’s more prestigious, maybe, to actually produce physical results than to work on tools,” said Ruijl.

And this is how we keep pushing people towards career death, burnout due to overwork or out of academia entirely.

https://www.wired.com/story/a-crucial-particle-physics-computer-program-risks-obsolescence/

title: Sidekiq quere flooded with LowPriorityWorker for "Delete Actor" pull · Discussion #18347 · mastodon/mastodon

last_post.content:
Spotted an interesting Mastodon attack, currently low key - people creating, then deleting accounts. This causes the instance to send messages to every Fediverse instance to delete the content, causes the pull queue to bloat in Sidekiq. #fediadmin

See also: https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/discussions/18347

Looking for something fun to do in 2023? Why not learn how to hack mainframes :blobcatthinkingsunglass:​ ?

This container was built for our DEFCON 30 workshop. It will walk you through three challenging buffer overflows on a real mainframe OS. The first challenge is a simple C program buffer overflow, the second a buffer overflow and privesc and finally remote code execution over FTP.

https://hub.docker.com/r/mainframed767/defcon30

title: Shopify Tells Employees to Just Say No to Meetings

last_post.content:
A few days ago, I encouraged canceling all recurring meetings in the new year and only adding them back if truly necessary.

Shopify just did that at a company level by banning recurring meetings with over 2 people and now large meetings only on Thursdays.
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-01-03/shopify-ceo-tobi-lutke-tells-employees-to-just-say-no-to-meetings

JOB ANNOUNCEMENT!

Reposting since I moved instances -- please spread widely.

We're hiring at the Assistant/Associate #Professor level in the Complex Human Data Hub at #UniMelb.

It's a combined #research and #teaching position, for researchers who study any topic within #mathematical or #computational #cognitive/#social science (broadly construed). We're especially interested in applications from #women and #minorities.

Closing date is Feb 2nd, and all details can be found at the link below. Melbourne is awesome and so are we so come join us!

https://psychologicalsciences.unimelb.edu.au/chdh/news/we-are-hiring

@tiago

It's mostly UI, the below link when viewed from treehouse shows what UI they chose to go with:

https://social.treehouse.systems/@ariadne/109579590960174118

title: Muzzled by DeSantis, Critical Race Theory Professors Cancel Courses or Modify Their Teaching

last_post.content:
Muzzled by DeSantis, Critical Race Theory Professors Cancel Courses or Modify Their Teaching
--
It’s easy to dismiss the conservative crusade against #CRT as political theater without real consequences. But most colleges & universities offer social science and humanities courses that address racial inequality and systemic racism, and the anti-CRT laws are already having repercussions for people who teach or take these classes in red states.

#race #education #Florida

https://www.propublica.org/article/desantis-critical-race-theory-florida-college-professors?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=mastodon-post

⭕ 𝗖𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗮𝗹𝗣𝘆 (https://lnkd.in/dVQu93PH)
A new kid on the block released less than two months ago. CausalPy is based on @pymc_labs PyMC - a well-established probabilistic programming framework in Python. CausalPy has been developed by PyMC’s prolific @benvincent with contributions from Wolt’s excellent data scientist @juanitorduz. CausalPy implements a bunch of methods to work with quasi-experimental data. Everything in Bayesian fashion!

(5/6)

Very interesting breakdown of the earnings of an YouTube channel with 3M subscribers.

Main takeaway: you need around a couple of million subscribers to live comfortably off YouTube alone.
